usefulItems: baking sheet, parchment paper, cling wrap, refrigerator, oven
title: Seafood Quesadillas

ingredients.content: 8 oz mozzarella cheese, cut into pieces (1 in.)
10 ½ oz fresh raw shrimp, peeled, deveined, cut into pieces (1 in.)
10 ½ oz cooked octopus, cut into pieces (1 in.)
10 ½ oz red snapper fillet, boneless, skinless, cut into pieces (1 in.)
2 oz white onion, cut into pieces
5 ½ oz fresh pineapple, cut into pieces

preparations.content: Line a baking sheet with parchment and set aside.
Place mozzarella cheese into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside. Rinse and dry mixing bowl.
Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in raw shrimp, cooked octopus and red snapper. Set bowl with seafood aside.

Place ancho chili, paprika, cayenne pepper, chipotle powder, whole clove, cumin, coriander seeds and oregano into mixing bowl and grind <b>30 sec/speed 10<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add onion, garlic, pineapple, apple cider vinegar, orange juice, oil, salt and pepper and blend <b>30 sec/speed 6<b>. Transfer to bowl with reserved seafood, cover with cling wrap, refrigerate and allow to marinate at least one hour.
Place marinated seafood onto prepared baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes (350°F).
Remove seafood from oven, transfer to a bowl and mix gently. Remove parchment from baking sheet.
Place six tortillas onto baking sheet, spread reserved grated cheese evenly over tortillas, top with cooked seafood and cover with remaining tortillas.
Bake for 15 minutes (350°F) or until golden brown.
Cut Seafood Quesadillas into wedges and serve.

hintsAndTricks: Cook quesadillas over a medium-hot skillet or comal.
For a more developed flavor, marinate seafood for at least six hours.
